intro: Coleus mirabilis var. hypisodontus, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its foliage and inflorescence make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
